revised_title: Obituary of Charles Brooke and John Allan Broun
tldr: This article is an obituary for Charles Brooke and John Allan Broun, two notable figures in the scientific community. Charles Brooke was a surgeon and inventor, known for his self-recording instruments used in meteorology and his improvements in microscopy. John Allan Broun was a leader in the science of terrestrial magnetism and directed the observatory at Makerstoun. Both men made significant contributions to various fields of science and are remembered for their dedication and work.
